content: Write a sonnet about rainforests in the style of Edgar Allan Poe.

In the sullen heart of shadowed lands,
Where sunlight dares not pierce the verdant veil,
A realm of mystery and darkness stands,
Where ancient trees in silence forever wail.

Beneath the canopy, where gloom doth reign,
The forest breathes with life in every breath,
Yet death lurks close, in every hidden vein,
And time itself seems to have lost its death.

Here, in this place of eternal night,
The spirits of the past still linger on,
Their whispers carried by the misty light,
That shrouds the forest in a mournful tone.

Oh, rainforest dark, thy beauty is a curse,
For in thy depths, both life and death converge.
